intro: Oligogyne bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia oligogyne, is a rare flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include narrow, grass-like leaves and a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
